references: J. Barkley Rosser and Lowell Schoenfeld, Abstracts of Scientific Communications, Internat. Congress Math., Moscow, 1966, Section 3, Theory of Numbers. They show 2pi(x) > pi(2x) for x>10. - from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 03 2013, corrected Jul 09 2015
D. S. Mitrinovic et al., Handbook of Number Theory, Kluwer, Section VII.5, p. 235.
Sanford Segal, On Pi(x+y)<=Pi(x)+Pi(y). Transactions American Mathematical Society, 104 (1962), 523-527.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eugene Ehrhart, On prime numbers, Fibonacci Quarterly 26:3 (1988), pp. 271-274. Shows a(n)>0 for n>10.
formula: a(n) = Mod[2*PrimePi[n], PrimePi[2n]] = 2*A000720(n)-A000720(2n) for n>1.a(n) ~ 2n log 2 / (log n)^2, by the prime number theorem. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 12 2007a(n) = -A047886(n,n) (but see A212210-A212213). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 15 2008
mathematica: f[n_] := 2 PrimePi[n] - PrimePi[2 n]; Array[f, 122] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 12 2011 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 19 2001
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 03 2013
